Legal_Issue: Whether Corporal Berger's death was directly connected to his military service under the Pension Act
Evidence_Assessment: Swimming activity during high-risk operation, 24/7 duty context
Decision_Outcome: Death found to be directly connected to military service
Burden_of_Proof: On applicant to show connection between death and service
Legal_Rule: Pension awarded if death arose out of or was directly connected with military service
Grounds_for_Claim: Denial of pension due to lack of direct connection to service
Outcome_on_Merits: Claim allowed; Board decision set aside
Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: Board failed to consider full context of service duties
Key_Evidence_Considered: Nature of operation, duty status at time of death, swimming activity in operational context
Defendant_Response: Death occurred during recreational activity, not service-related duty
Evidence_Type: Operational records, duty logs, incident report
Legal_Provision: Pension Act - 'directly connected with military service'
Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Allegatio: Lack of direct connection between death and military service
Applicable_Process: Administrative appeal followed by judicial review
Jurisdiction: Federal court jurisdiction over veterans' benefits
Governing_Rule: Pension Act requirement for service connection
